Question
========
Which of the following statements is **correct**?

Answerlist
----------
* The mean of a Standard Normal distribution is always 0.00 and the standard deviation is always 1.96.
* The Standard Error (SE) for both a proportion and a mean is dependent on the sample size.
* For the Standard Normal Distribution, 10% of the observations must be score at least 1.96 times the standard deviation higher than the mean value.
* With a 95% confidence interval, the sample value is always in the "critical range" of 5%.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------
* False
* True
* False
* False
